info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 7 at 3:36PM CDT until July 7 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern McCulloch County in west central Texas... Menard County in west central Texas...
* Until 545 PM CDT.
* At 333 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have generally moved west of the area. However, heavy rainfall since 1 PM continues to run off into creeks, streams, and other poor drainage areas. Flooding of these areas may continue through 5 PM until the flood water can recede.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Menard, Hext, Saline, Fort Mckavett, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Highway 29, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773, Us-190 Near The Menard-Mcculloch County Line, Camp Sol Mayer, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line and Erna.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 5:45 PM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 5:45 PM CDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 5:45 PM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 5:45 PM CDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
